text: Ettela'at is a Persian-language daily newspaper published in Tehran, Iran. It is one of the oldest newspapers in the country and the oldest Persian daily still running in the world. The newspaper has a conservative view and covers political, cultural, social, and economic news. Before the 1979 Iranian Revolution, it was linked to its founder, Abbas Massoudi (1895â€“1974). == References == == Other websites == * Category:Newspapers by country Category:Newspapers in Asia
